p: However, microbiota can be altered by exposure to dietary mNP. In vitro experiments performed on a colon-like microbial community showed that exposure to small quantities of E171 (comparable to the amount present in two pieces of chewing gum) was sufficient to alter the phylogenetic composition[ 90]. Significant changes in the phyla were also observed in mice treated for 28 d with TiO2NP, with variations induced by both forms of TiO2NP, namely rutilium and anatase[ 91].
